column4: hey i install new kernel but when i do apt-get update! still receive update from old kernel? what's wrong ? how i can make it check update of my current kernel ?
did you do update-grub ?
what do u mean? i change the menu.lst only to new kernel
so you have to do a sudo update-grub
!ask | lexxy
the new kernel i didn't name it  like vmlinuz-2.6.28-11-generic i name it kad-2.6.30 ! does this make effect since when i do update-grub give me old one !
it dont matter what you name the kernel you still have to update grub.
i did update-grub ! give me the old kernel not the new one ? why ?
it has to point to that kernel image
i add this to menu.lst the new kernel and when i do uname -r give me new kernel! but on update-grub don't? how i can fix it ?
is that the name of the original kernel you downloaded, and if not does that name point to it in some way..if not you have to name it the same as what you downloaded.
download it as : linux-2.6.30
yes if thats the name of what it was when you downloaded it thats probably the name you will have to put in your grub menu.lst.
okie i'll change to the original name
then do update-grub again.
still the same :(
then something dont seem right can you paste the outcome of update-grub ?
i pastebin update-grub and menu.lst http://pastebin.com/m1531aa3
any issue ?
im not real sure, not to use to grub yet, more of a lilo man myself...maybe someone in here can look at it an see.
ok thx
sorry its been a long day and im falling asleep...sorry
